author: Lance

review: Ten minutes after opening the box, we were watching a movie on Netflix. About six minutes of that time was spent picking out a movie. Downloading and installing the Chromecast app and setting up the device on the wireless network was a breeze. We've had no problems with it at all, with the caveat that we've only had it for a week. It doesn't do everything that the streaming media device on our other TV does -- it won't stream content from a local computer hard drive -- but then it cost about $300 less so that seems fair. I would recommend Chromecast to friends and family without reservation.

review: I was one of those people who was excited about this cheap little streamer. I got it from amazon and tested it out by following the instruction. For some reason that my device was not able to be found on the home network. I googled for solutions and found many people have the same issue. I then updated the firmware of my router then it works and fix the issue. I tested by broadcasting videos that play in the chrome browser and it works like a charm. Playing netflex from my phone also is another awesome feature. I would recommend this device for people that doesn't have a smart TV and looking for a cheap but quality video streamer.
